<RESUME_START>
BUSINESS DEVELOPMENT EXECUTIVE

SUMMARY

Results driven sales professional with an exemplary record of developing strategic initiatives to enhance sales.
Thrives on a challenge, initiates action and entrepreneurial in business approach.
Able to seize opportunities and demonstrates excellent networking skills.
Exudes energy and enthusiasm while consistently meeting or exceeding sales targets.
Offers an excellent record of experience and accomplishments.
QUALIFICATION HIGHLIGHTS Account/Territory Management Contract Negotiations Client Development/Focus Sales Analysis Strategic Planning Quota Attainment Business Development/Market Growth Team Leadership Consultative Sales and Network Solutions

EXPERIENCE

Business Development Executive
Responsible for managing the entire sales cycle with accountability to engage specialist team members; Aggressive and active in competitive accounts, knowledgeable regarding competition and industry trends; Identify, articulate, and implement products, solutions and services to customer requirements; Articulate and position full spectrum of OfficeMax products, services, and solutions to key departmental decision makers; Develop and implement business plan for client base to identify, sell, and support services and/or products in existing OfficeMax accounts; Responsible for proposing and closing engagements that will achieve total revenue growth (sale and annuity), profit, and customer satisfaction plans; Perform account maintenance and continuous new business development; Work with the in-territory BRM and other resources to accomplish install, revenue, and profit objectives; Develop plans for growth and solicit buy-in from management; Perform presentations internally and externally on existing capabilities to gain support.

Client Advisor
Developed new business leads and increase client base through focused personal marketing efforts that include, but not limited to, direct mail, networking affiliations, and telemarketing ; Accommodated client product preference via presentation and demonstration; Kept abreast of incoming inventory, features, accessories, etc and determine the benefits to prospective clients; Conducted needs assessments of potential buyers; Ensured proper follow up of all potential buyers by developing, implementing, and monitoring a prospecting and sales control system; Maintained comprehensive knowledge of pricing and specifications of competitive vehicles to provide clients with informative comparisons; Made effective deliveries by following all sales details, inspecting every vehicle sold, introducing clients to Service Manager, and making a personalized delivery of the vehicle.
Key Contributions Awarded Client Advisor of the Month 18 times; Achieved BMW of North America's highest sales award for exceeding yearly sales quotas for 2006 and 2007 Received sales incentive awards for the most on-the-spot sales and client retention.

Key Contributions Gained highest sales percentage from new product growth since March 2005 Achieved quarterly sales goal as well as maintained top 25% status throughout tenure Built key relationships to successfully gain access to physicians that were often difficult to see.

Key Contributions Achieved 100% of a $3M quota during fiscal year 2001 and 2002 Received highest sales award company-wide February 2000 Received Team Player award for second quarter 2001 Received Document Management Consultant of the Year award for 2001 and 2002.

<JD_START>
Job Title: Federal Business Development Manager

Location: Ashburn, VA

Employment Type: full-time

Listed Skills: Business Development, Sales

Description:
The Business Development plays a pivotal role in driving growth and expansion for Client. This leadership position is responsible for identifying strategic opportunities, forging key partnerships, and driving revenue growth through new business initiatives. The role requires a seasoned professional with a deep understanding of the industry, exceptional strategic thinking, and strong leadership skills. The position requires the ability to work full spectrum Business Development – from the identification of new opportunities to pursuit, capture, and proposal submission. This position also requires the ability to interface with government customers on a regular basis. This position reports to the Chief Growth Officer of Client. This is a hybrid job position with an expectation of working from ClientHeadquarters, in Ashburn, at least two- three days per week.
Duties and Responsibilities• Pipeline Planning and execution: Develop and execute a comprehensive business development pipeline aligned with the company's objectives to achieve revenue and market share growth.• New Business Identification and Capture: Achieve revenue targets by identifying, pursuing, and capturing new business opportunities. Foster a culture of sales excellence and customer satisfaction.• Market Analysis: Analyze industry trends and market dynamics to identify emerging opportunities and threats. Stay informed about competitor activities and market shifts.• Partnership Development: Establish and maintain relationships with potential partners, clients, and key stakeholders. Collaborate on mutually beneficial business ventures.• Product and Service Expansion: Evaluate and recommend new product or service offerings that align with market demands and company capabilities.• Contract Negotiation: Negotiate contracts, agreements, and partnerships to ensure favorable terms and conditions for the company.• Budget Management: Develop and manage bid and proposal allocations to optimize resource allocation and achieve strategic objectives.• Reporting and Analysis: Provide regular reports and updates to the executive team, highlighting key performance metrics and progress toward growth goals.
Requirements and Qualifications• Bachelor's degree and proven track record of at least 10 years in business development, with a minimum of 5 years in a leadership role. Working knowledge of the Federal Government Cybersecurity market space is essential.• Deep industry knowledge and an extensive network of industry contacts. Preferred experience within DOD, DHS and/or the Federal Civilian marketplace.• Strong strategic thinking and analytical skills, with the ability to identify and prioritize growth opportunities.• Exceptional negotiation and contract management skills.• Excellent written communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to build and maintain relationships at all levels. Full familiarity with the Shipley’s capture process and a proven track record of winning new business in the Cybersecurity and/or Enterprise IT market.• Ability to improvise, adapt and overcome challenges. An inquisitive mind and a thirst for knowledge. Ability to adapt to a dynamic business environment and make data-driven decisions.• Results-oriented mindset, with a demonstrated ability to meet and exceed revenue targets.• Willingness to travel as required to establish and maintain business relationships with government and industry customers and partners.

Experience Level (if available): None
<JD_END>
